articles.title: U.S. Urged Not to Adventure Military Actions
articles.content:
U.S. Urged Not to Adventure Military Actions
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee in a statement Thursday denounced the U.S. for having gone desperate to modernize and boost the attack capabilities of nuclear strategic assets, to be hurled into the Korean peninsula in case of contingency, while staging joint military drills after introducing Carl Vinson and Ronald Reagan nuclear carrier strike groups into the East Sea of Korea.
					 The statement said:
					
					 This evidently proves again that the U.S. intention to bring down the DPRK by force, hold a military edge in the Asia-Pacific region and, furthermore, realize its dream of world domination will never change and that the chief culprit rendering the situation of the Korean peninsula and the region extremely tense is none other than the U.S.
					
					 Problem is that such military reinforcement is pushed forward when the U.S. high-ranking authorities let out such rhetoric that "it would neither seek regime change nor invasion of the north but leave the social system intact" and "war with the north would bring disaster".
					
					 Through the long stand-off with it, the DPRK is well aware of the crafty nature of the U.S. always watching for a chance while spurring the preparations for a war of aggression behind the talk of "peace".
					
					 If the U.S. pursues military stand-off, failing to face up to the reality, the DPRK has the intent to pester it more and present it with bigger "package of gift" in the end.
					
					 The U.S. had better make a wise option though belatedly, before it may face further disgrace, clearly understanding that time, justice and final victory all belong to the DPRK holding firm the most powerful nuclear weapon.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Declares Stand on Rocket Test-fire for Self-Defence
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Declares Stand on Rocket Test-fire for Self-Defence
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK declared the following principled stand on the recent successful test-fire of ballistic rocket at the plenary meeting of the second-round of the Geneva Disarmament Conference on May 30:
					 The DPRK's test-fire of ballistic rocket is an exercise of the right to self-defence to cope with the reckless aggression moves of the U.S. chiefly responsible for the escalated tension on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Some countries' criticism of this is a wanton violation of the sovereignty and interference in internal affairs of the DPRK.
					
					 The UN Security Council took issue only with the DPRK's bolstering up its military capability for self-defence, in disregard of the test-fire of ICBM by the U.S. This is an unpardonable discrimination and the height of double-standard.
					
					 The more the U.S. and its vassal forces pull up the DPRK over its step for bolstering its nuclear forces, the further the DPRK will diversify and develop the nuclear force at a high level.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Inspects Rice-planting in Sukchon and Mundok Counties
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Inspects Rice-planting in Sukchon and Mundok Counties
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of rice-planting in Sukchon and Mundok counties, South Phyongan Province.
					 Visiting the Yoldusamchon Farm in Sukchon County and Ryongrim Co-op Farm in Mundok County, granary in the West Sea, he inspired agricultural workers in rice-transplanting and underscored the need to enforce a field-responsibility-system as required by the Party's intention and positively introduce the scientific farming method.
					
					 The premier convened a consultative meeting to stress the need for the units associated with leadership exploits of the great leaders to take the lead in the struggle to attain the grain production goal set by the Party and supply materials necessary for farming.

articles.title: FM General Director Meets Spanish Members of House of Representatives
articles.content:
FM General Director Meets Spanish Members of House of Representatives
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Son Gyong, general director of the European Department 2 of the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK, had a talk with Merithel Ramana, secretary of the Commission of Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives of Spain, its spokesman Sanchez Amor and other members of the commission at the parliamentary building on May 29. 
					 Kim Son Gyong informed the Spanish side of the DPRK's stand on the relations between the two countries. She stressed that the U.S. hostile policy and nuclear threats to the DPRK should be removed, first of all, for the defusing of the tension on the Korean peninsula. 
					
					 Members of the House of Representatives of Spain expressed the will to respect the sovereignty of the DPRK and make efforts for promoting exchanges and cooperation between the two countries in tourism, education, sports and other fields.
					
					 They hoped that tension would be defused on the Korean peninsula and the problems be settled peacefully through dialogue.
					
					 Meanwhile, Kim Son Gyong attended the round-table talks under the theme "Present situation on the Korean peninsula and prospect of DPRK-EU relations" held at the Elcano Royal Institute on May 30.
					
					 Present there were Spanish personages of political, academic and business circles.
					
					 Kim Son Gyong in her keynote speech explained the root cause of the tense situation on the Korean peninsula, the inevitability of the DPRK's access to nuclear weapons and the DPRK principled stand on the relations with EU. She gave answers to the questions raised. 
					
					 The participants expressed the will to make positive contributions to improving the relations between the DPRK and Spain and between the DPRK and EU.

articles.title: Joint Friendship Gathering Held to Mark Int'l Children's Day
articles.content:
Joint Friendship Gathering Held to Mark Int'l Children's Day
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- A joint friendship gathering for marking the 67th anniversary of International Children's Day took place at the Rungna People's Pleasure Park here on Thursday.
					 Attending it were Choe Ryong Hae, Jon Kwang Ho, vice-premier of the Cabinet, and officials concerned and kindergarteners and teachers and women in the city.
					
					 Also, present on invitation were members of foreign embassies and international body missions here and children, women and guests of different countries and overseas compatriots.
					
					 Addressing the gathering, Jang Chun Sil, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the women's union, expressed belief that all children of the country would grow up to be sunflowers following the sun only and excellent pillars who are qualified intellectually, morally and physically.
					
					 A stage of pleasant and joyful folk plays by children was displayed before sports and amusement games.
					
					 At the end of the games, the participants had a pleasant time, dancing with children and enjoying skills presented by sea animals at the Rungna Dolphinarium.
					
					 Meanwhile, diverse commemoration events took place in provinces, cities and counties of the country.

articles.title: "Sonyon" Light Aircraft Presented to People's Army
articles.content:
"Sonyon" Light Aircraft Presented to People's Army
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- "Sonyon" (child) light aircraft provided by the schoolchildren across the country was presented to the People's Army with due ceremony on Thursday on the occasion of the 8th Congress of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) and the 71st KCU birthday.
					 Attending it was Kim Nung O, chairman of the North Phyongan Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Jong Kyong Il, chairman of the North Phyongan Provincial People's Committee, officials concerned, service personnel and schoolchildren.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the Central Committee of the youth league, said that the above-said light aircraft reflects the patriotic mind and rock-firm will of all the schoolchildren to uphold respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un with loyalty and reliably carry forward the revolutionary traditions of Juche and defend the socialist country impregnably.
					
					 A certificate for presenting the light aircraft was handed over to an officer of the Air and Anti-Air Force of the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: Delegation of State Emergency Disaster Committee Returns
articles.content:
Delegation of State Emergency Disaster Committee Returns
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the State Emergency Disaster Committee headed by Chairman Kang Il Sop came back home Thursday after taking part in the world forum for prevention of danger of disaster held in Cancun City of Mexico.

articles.title: Symposium on Greenhouse Vegetable Farming Opens Here
articles.content:
Symposium on Greenhouse Vegetable Farming Opens Here
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- A sci-tech symposium on greenhouse vegetable farming-2017 opened with due ceremony at the Pyongyang Vegetable Science Institute under the Institute of Agricultural Science Thursday.
					 The symposium, under the theme "Mallima speed movement, technology of greenhouse vegetable seed production and standardization of plant-care", will include presentation of successes and experience gained in research and production of greenhouse vegetables, workshops, lectures and visit to different units.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Kwak Pom Gi, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kye Yong Sam, director of the Institute of Agricultural Science, officials concerned, scientists, technicians and gardeners of greenhouse vegetable production units and science research institutes.
					
					 Ko In Ho, vice-premier and minister of Agriculture, made an opening address.
					
					 The symposium will last till June 16.

articles.title: Members of FAO Mission Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Members of FAO Mission Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Members of the mission of the UN Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) here did assistance work at the Hyongsan Vegetable Cooperative Farm in Hyongjesan District of Pyongyang on Thursday.
					 They helped its peasants in rice-transplanting.
					
					 They handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Seminar Marks 80th Anniversary of Victorious Battle of Pochonbo
articles.content:
Seminar Marks 80th Anniversary of Victorious Battle of Pochonbo
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- A seminar in the field of social sciences took place at the Korean Revolution Museum on Thursday to mark the 80th anniversary of the victorious historic battle of Pochonbo commanded by President Kim Il Sung.
					 The seminar heard the papers on revolutionary feats the President performed by leading the battle to victory.
					
					 Through the battle, he demonstrated the Korean people's firm anti-imperialist stand to regain the sovereignty and dignity of the nation by fighting against the Japanese imperialists to the last and the firm independent stand to achieve the historic cause of liberating the country without fail by the Korean nation itself, the speakers said.
					
					 They noted that the victorious battle planted in the minds of the Korean people the mainstay of the firm faith that the cause of liberating the country was certain to be accomplished thanks to him, and fully displayed the might of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army and served as an important occasion in encouraging broad masses of people to turn out in the sacred war of liberating the country.
					
					 The flames kindled by the President in Pochonbo were everlasting ones of revolution to encourage the army and people of the DPRK to bring about rapid progress in the confrontation with the U.S.-led imperialism and in the accomplishment of the cause of building a socialist power with the conviction of the final victory in the Juche revolution.
					
					 The seminar was attended by teachers, researchers, lecturers, journalists, editors and officials of scientific, educational and media institutions, the field of the preservation of revolutionary relics and party cadres training institutions.

articles.title: Great Victory in Battle of Pochonbo
articles.content:
Great Victory in Battle of Pochonbo
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Eighty years have passed since the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA) won victory in the battle of Pochonbo on June 4, 1937 thanks to the outstanding military stratagem of President Kim Il Sung.
					 At that time, the Korea-China border was said to have been tightly guarded by the Japanese imperialists with four cordons, for the original three had been found to be unsatisfactory. There were as many as 300 police stations and substations in the northern border area, manned by repressive, highly mobile forces several thousand strong.
					
					 Grasping the enemy deployment and topographical conditions, the President ordered the main force of the KPRA to build a raft bridge and cross the River Amnok to steal into the homeland.
					
					 His outstanding stratagem was also verified by setting the attack target in keeping with changes in situation.
					
					 When he was informed that a KPRA unit was encircled by the enemy in the area of Pegae Hill on its way to the Musan area, he diverted the attack target of the main force from Hyesan to Pochonbo to attain the purpose of its advance into the homeland as well as rescue the encircled unit.
					
					 In this regard, the President said in his reminiscences "With the Century" as follows:
					
					 If we attack Pochonbo, the enemy concentrated on the Pegae Hill area will find itself in a danger of being surrounded by both our main forces and Choe Hyon's unit. They will then be forced to abandon their plan of encirclement and pursuit and will withdraw from the line they have reached. Moreover, an attack on Pochonbo will have as strong an impact on the homeland as an attack on Hyesan. Therefore, our aim of advancing into the homeland will also be achieved.

articles.title: Female Acrobatic Gymnastic Coach of Merit
articles.content:
Female Acrobatic Gymnastic Coach of Merit
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Pak Sun Nyo, acrobatic gymnastic coach of the Sports Team of the Ministry of Commerce of the DPRK, is well known in the country for her contribution to the development of acrobatic gymnastics.
					 She started her career as a coach from 2007 and has brought up many aces who have proved successful at domestic and international games.
					
					 Among them are Ri Chol Jun, who was awarded a special technique prize by taking the second place in men's duet at the international acrobatic gymnastics tournament held in 2013, and others who brought home a gold and six silver medals at the 9th Asian Acrobatic Gymnastic Championship.
					
					 At the 25th World Acrobatic Gymnastics Championship held in 2016, an acrobatic movement created by her was highly appreciated as a world-level one of high technique.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses Purpose of Japan's Retrogressive Revision of Constitution
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses Purpose of Japan's Retrogressive Revision of Constitution
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Days ago, the prime minister of Japan instructed Yasuoka, chief of the promotion headquarters for revision of the constitution of the Liberal Democratic Party, to work out an amendment to the constitution for the Screening Council of both houses of the Diet. And he expressed again the will to enforce a new constitution in 2020.
					 Under this instruction, the secretary general of LDP and the chief of its promotion headquarters discussed on strengthening the headquarters and hastening the deliberations on the issue to work out an amendment to the constitution. The amendment will be reportedly made within this year and submitted to the Screening Council of both houses of the Diet at its regular session to be held in January next year.
					
					 Commenting on the fact, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says:
					
					 What the Japanese ultra-right reactionaries seek mainly through the retrogressive revision of constitution is to realize the old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" at any cost Japan failed to do so in the past.
					
					 They have already cooked up the security legislation, emergency law, law on special measures against terrorism, etc. to provide legal and institutional steps that allow the "Self-Defense Forces" to conduct military activities in the vast Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 Now they are going to scrap the framework of "Pacifist Constitution" and advance to overseas aggression, unhindered.
					
					 It is a matter of time for Japan to revive militarism and launch reinvasion.
					
					 Nobody can vouch that another era of nightmare of bloodshed and plunder like the one in the first half of the 20th century would not repeat itself.
					
					 The Japanese reactionary ruling quarters should bear in mind that if they run amuck with wild ambition for militarist reinvasion, they will face catastrophic defeat only.

articles.title: S. Korean Teachers' Union Starts Sit-in
articles.content:
S. Korean Teachers' Union Starts Sit-in
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The Teachers Union of south Korea started an over-night sit-in in Seoul on May 29 to demand the withdrawal of the declaration of the union as outlawed by the Park Geun Hye group, according to the south Korean internet paper Jaju Sibo.
					 Before the action, the body blamed Park for violating the basic right of the union and suppressing its activities through the issuance of an illegal document, follow-up measure, secret cooperation between the public security forces and conservative organizations.
					
					 The cancellation of the official document that was issued under Park's rule would mean abolition of one evil, the organization said.
					
					 It declared they would start sit-in for the withdrawal of the document, revision of the law on trade union and acquisition of three rights to labor.

articles.title: Abolition of Labor Evils Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Abolition of Labor Evils Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) started an intensive sit-in in demand of minimum wage hike, solution of part-time job and change of labor policy on May 29, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Jaju Sibo.
					 At a press conference held in Seoul, the KCTU clarified that the sit-in is aimed at urging the new "government" to set positive and proper labor and social reform policy.
					
					 A resolution adopted there declared that the organization would stage a sit-in at Kwanghwamun Plaza from May 29 to June 14.
					
					 It expressed the will of KCTU to make every effort to make "hell-like south Korea" into a new society for workers by general strike.

articles.title: Japan's Brazen-faced Attitude to Crimes Related to Sexual Slavery Slashed
articles.content:
Japan's Brazen-faced Attitude to Crimes Related to Sexual Slavery Slashed
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea issued a commentary on May 29 denouncing the Japanese government's brazen-faced attitude toward the crimes related to the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, according to a report.
					 The Japanese government distorted the truth about the sexual slavery at international arena including the UN and has trumpeted about "solution through agreement", the commentary said.
					
					 It demanded that the present south Korean "government" clarify its will to seek prompt and proper solution and disclose the absurdity of "agreement" before the international community.
					
					 Solution based on common sense and international human rights principles including the Japanese government's official apology and legal reparation for the crimes can be a final and irreversible solution, the commentary stressed.

articles.title: Russian, UK Organizations Hail DPRK's Bolstering Nuclear Deterrence
articles.content:
Russian, UK Organizations Hail DPRK's Bolstering Nuclear Deterrence
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Russian and British organizations issued statements on May 22 and 23 as regards the DPRK's successful test-fire of ground-to-ground medium-to-long range strategic ballistic missile Pukguksong-2.
					 Congratulating the DPRK's scientists and technicians on the success in the test-fire of Pukguksong-2, the Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK said in its statement:
					
					 The successive successful test-fire displayed once again the indomitable will of the Korean people under the wise leadership of Comrade Kim Jong Un and their big progress in the field of rocket.
					
					 Under his guidance, the DPRK is demonstrating its dignity as a nuclear power in the East.
					
					 The recent final test-fire of ballistic missile enhanced the might of the Strategic Force of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 We wish the Korean people greater success in the work to bolster up the national defence capability.
					
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Korean Friendship Association UK and the British preparatory committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu in a joint statement fully supported the DPRK's bolstering of nuclear deterrence, saying that the recent test-fire was part of its step for self-defence to cope with the U.S. imperialists' escalating moves to stifle it.

articles.title: CCPAP aconseja a EE.UU. que deje la aventura militar anti-RPDC
articles.content:
CCPAP aconseja a EE.UU. que deje la aventura militar anti-RPDC
Pyongyang, primero de junio (ACNC) -- EE.UU. desarrolla en el Mar Este de Corea los ejercicios militares conjuntos movilizando las flotillas de portaaviones nucleares Carl Vinson y Ronald Reagan y al mismo tiempo, se enfrasca en modernizar las propiedades estrategicas nucleares para el tiempo de emergencia de la Peninsula Coreana y elevar su capacidad de ataque. 
					Al respecto, el portavoz del Comite Coreano por la Paz de Asia y el Pacifico (CCPAP) hizo publica este jueves una declaracion que sigue:
					
					El mencionado movimiento militar demuestra una vez mas que no se cambia nunca el malsano intento de EE.UU. de atropellar por la fuerza a la RPDC, tomar la supremacia militar en la region de Asia-Pacifico y realizar la ambicion de dominar el mundo y el primero es el autor principal de la agravacion extremada de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y el resto de la region.
					
					El problema es que las altas autoridades estadounidenses recurren al fortalecimiento de la capacidad militar pronunciando palabras contradictorias como "no intentan cambiar el poder del Norte de Corea ni agredirlo y preservaran su regimen" y "la guerra con el Norte de Corea sera un desastre". 
					
					A traves de la larga historia de enfrentamiento con EE.UU. supimos muy bien el caracter ladino de ese pais que detras de la consigna de la "paz", da acicate a los preparativos de la guerra de agresion acechando la oportunidad.
					
					Si EE.UU. sigue persiguiendo el infructifero enfrentamiento militar sin ver bien la realidad, estaremos dispuestos a molestarle hasta el final y enviarle el mayor "paquete de regalo". 
					
					Antes de perder mas honra, EE.UU. ha de tomar una opcion sensata teniendo presente que el tiempo, la justicia y la victoria final estan al lado de la RPDC que cuenta con el mas poderoso medio nuclear.

articles.title: Delegacion coreana justifica el ejercicio del derecho a la autodefensa de de la RPDC
articles.content:
Delegacion coreana justifica el ejercicio del derecho a la autodefensa de de la RPDC
Pyongyang, primero de junio (ACNC) -- En la sesion plenaria del segundo periodo de la Conferencia de Ginebra sobre el Desarme, celebrada el 30 de mayo, la delegacion coreana expuso la siguiente posicion de principios sobre el exitoso lanzamiento de prueba de cohete balistico recien efectuado por la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea:
					El lanzamiento de prueba de cohete balistico de la RPDC deviene el ejercicio del derecho de autodefensa frente a las imprudentes maniobras de agresion de EE.UU., culpable principal de la agravante situacion de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					La censura de algunos paises sobre el respecto deviene abierta violacion de la soberania nacional e intervencion en los asuntos internos. 
					
					El Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU cuestiona el fortalecimiento de la capacidad de autodefensa nacional de la RPDC sin prestar atencion al lanzamiento de ICBM de EE.UU., lo cual es una discriminacion intolerable y climax de la pauta de doble rasero.
					
					La censura de EE.UU. y sus satelites no traera otro resultado mas que la diversificacion y el mejoramiento de las fuerzas armadas nucleares de la RPDC.

articles.title: Director del MINREX se reune con parlamentarios espanoles
articles.content:
Director del MINREX se reune con parlamentarios espanoles
Pyongyang, primero de junio (ACNC) -- Kim Son Gyong, titular de la Direccion No. 2 de Europa del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, se reunio el 29 de mayo en la sede de Cortes de Espana con el secretario Merithel Ramana, el vocero Sanchez Amor y otros miembros de la Comision de Asuntos Exteriores del Congreso de Diputados. 
					El diplomatico coreano informo la posicion de la RPDC sobre las relaciones entre los dos paises y subrayo que para el relajamiento de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana, hay que acabar primero con la politica hostil de Estados Unidos y su amenaza nuclear contra la RPDC.
					
					Los parlamentarios espanoles dijeron que respetan la soberania de la RPDC y se esforzaran por impulsar el intercambio y la cooperacion entre dos paises en varios sectores como el turismo, la educacion y el deporte. 
					
					Prosiguieron que desean el alivio de tension de la Peninsula Coreana y la solucion pacifica del problema a traves del dialogo.
					
					El dia 30, Kim tomo parte en la mesa redonda efectuada en el Instituto Real ELCANO con el tema "La actual situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y las perspectivas de relaciones entre la RPDC y la Union Europea". 
					
					En esa ocasion, participaron las personalidades de los circulos politico, academico y empresarial de Espana.
					
					En su discurso de base, el visitante explico la causa raigal del empeoramiento de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana, la inevitable opcion de la RPDC de poseer el arma nuclear y su posicion de principios sobre las relaciones con la UE. 
					
					Seguidamente, respondio las preguntas planteadas. 
					
					Los participantes expusieron la voluntad de esforzarse activamente por hacer aporte al desarrollo de relaciones entre la RPDC y Espana y entre la RPDC y la UE.

articles.title: Efectuado encuentro conjunto de amistad por Dia Internacional de la Infancia
articles.content:
Efectuado encuentro conjunto de amistad por Dia Internacional de la Infancia
Pyongyang, primero de junio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar hoy en el Area de Recreo del Pueblo de Rungna el encuentro conjunto de amistad por el 67o aniversario del Dia Internacional de la Infancia Primero de Junio.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes Choe Ryong Hae, el vicepremier Jon Kwang Ho y los funcionarios interesados, los ninos del Jardin de Infancia de la Fabrica Textil Kim Jong Suk de Pyongyang, el Orfanato de Pyongyang y otros guarderias infantiles capitalinos, nineras, educadoras y las mujeres.
					
					Fueron invitados los miembros de las representaciones diplomaticas y de las organizaciones internacionales en la RPDC, los ninos y mujeres extranjeros, los huespedes extranjeros y los coreanos residentes en ultramar.
					
					En su discurso pronunciado en el acto, la presidenta del Comite Central de la Union Socialista de Mujeres de Corea, Jang Chun Sil, expreso la conviccion de que todos los ninos del pais creceran como los trabajadores, fieles al Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, con ricos conocimientos, nobles virtudes y buena salud.
					
					Se ofrecieron los juegos folkloricos y otros deportivos y recreativos de los ninos.
					
					Terminados los juegos, los participantes pasaron el tiempo alegre bailando con los ninos y viendo los talentos de animales maritimos en el Acuario de Delfines de Rungna.
					
					Por otra parte, todas las provincias, ciudades y distritos celebraron la efemeride de ninos con diversos actos.

articles.title: Jon Sung Ho comenta las "4 bases" de la politica sobre la RPDC
articles.content:
Jon Sung Ho comenta las "4 bases" de la politica sobre la RPDC
Pyongyang, primero de junio (ACNC) -- Jon Sung Ho publico la vispera un comentario intitulado "Revelando el caracter enganoso y astuto de las '4 bases' de la nueva politica de la administracion Trump sobre Corea".
					Al cabo de estudiar durante varios meses pasados los proyectos de opcion para solucionar el "problema nuclear del Norte (de Corea)", la administracion Trump definio finalmente la "maxima presion e intervencion" como la politica sobre la RPDC, y recientemente, dio a la publicidad las "4 bases" que la concretan, recordo Jon y continuo:
					
					Entre las "4 bases", firmadas oficialmente por el mandatario estadounidense, la primera es no reconocer a la RPDC como pais poseedor de armas nucleares; la segunda, recrudecer todas las formas de sancion y presion; la tercera, no impulsar el "cambio del poder del Norte" y la cuarta, resolver finalmente el problema mediante el dialogo.
					
					Estas bases no pasan de ser un vergonzoso producto anticuado.
					
					La primera base no puede calificarse de una "politica", sino deviene una queja de quien esta en dilema.
					
					La RPDC poseyo armas nucleares no para el reconocimiento de alguien, sino para defender su dignidad y soberania desde la amenaza nuclear proveniente de Estados Unidos.
					
					Para colmo, nuestros artefactos no desapareceran aunque no los reconozcan otros.
					
					El hecho innegable es que ya no podra lograrse el sueno por la "renuncia nuclear del Norte" y se hizo mas firme la posicion estrategica de la RPDC.
					
					Vamos a hablar de la segunda base referente al fortalecimiento de la sancion y presion que no valen nada para la RPDC.
					
					Cuanto mas se recrudezca la presion anti-RPDC de los enemigos, tanto mas se fortalecera el poderio espiritual de la RPDC.
					
					Los cada dia mas crecientes alborotos de sanciones y presiones anti-RPDC de las fuerzas hostiles nos hacen  confirmar la seguridad de que estamos avanzando y triunfando.
					
					La tercera base contiene oficialmente las palabras implorantes de las altas figuras norteamericanas de que "No perseguiran el cambio del poder norcoreano. Crealo por favor".
					
					En el reverso de la promesa de "descartar el cambio del poder", hay la amenaza y chantaje de bandido. 
					
					  Quiere decir que si la RPDC no depone el arma nuclear, no vacilara en agredirla y derrocar su regimen.
					
					Sabemos muy bien como defender nuestro regimen.
					
					Es decir, debemos fortalecer la capacidad de autodefensa al fabricar mucho mas armas poderosas y medios de ataque nuclear del tipo Juche, con los cuales podremos imponer el pavor y muerte a los agresores que intentan atentar contra la soberania y el regimen de la RPDC.
					
					Se puede decir que la cuarta base es el ultimo recurso contradictorio a que se apela la administracion Trump empantanada en dilema.
					
					En el normal proceso de solucion del problema, el articulo "dialogo" debe situarse en la primera posicion de las llamadas "4 bases". Al contrario, aparece en el ultimo lugar con el adverbio "finalmente".
					
					Es que luego de doblegar a la RPDC mediante la maxima presion y sancion, EE.UU. sacara a ella a la mesa de dialogo para imponerle firmar el acta de capitulacion.
